Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2011 03:50AM lrpabon wrote: Hi there, they are taking the ovaries because I have a complex cyst on the ovary that has doubled in size over 4 wks.  They will need to do a frozen section to make sure there is no cancer there because right now they can't tell for sure.  Ovarian cancer seems to be a "silent killer", so they say.  About 75% of woman usually end up dying when it finally gets discovered.  There are no symptoms until it is already far gone.  I dont have any breast as I have had bilat. masectomy.   Thank you for your reply, I will look into the website.                                       Laurie
Posts.Title: Indentation on Breast SueI12345 aldumont01

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2010 10:38AM lrpabon wrote: Great poem, I will be starting radiation in a couple weeks.  You guys are encouraging.
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2011 03:48AM lrpabon wrote: Hi there, I just wanted to chime in on this conversation because I also had some dimpling on the lateral side of my left breast.  I just kept wondering if it was really something or just my imagination.  I also work in Radiology, so one day went and had my 1st mammo.  Had extra compression views and nothing showed up.  I was relieved and then about 6 months later decieded to see my family Dr.  She didn't really feel anything and referred me to the breast surgeon, which ended up being invasive lobular carcinoma stage 2b.  Insist on getting an ultrasound even when the mammo is negative.  That was oct 09 and I was 40.  The Dr. said it had probably been there for about 3 yrs.  Now I am facing a total hystectomy on Jan 25th and am a little nervous about  the instant menopause.  Any words of advice?
